title: So Whats the Outplay to Rengar?
body:
No I'm not here to baby rage I genuinely want to know how to counter or in better words not die instantly before I can blink while playing against {{champion:107}}  as an ADC I cant use {{summoner:4}} because his leap will still go though I cant {{summoner:7}} because my health bar is already gone{{item:3026}}  doesn't give me nearly enough armor to live I still die but just get revived and that has a 300 second CD then there is also {{item:3046}} but the issue with this is that I need to actually hit him first which is nearly impossible the only thing I can think of that will help is {{item:3812}} but I don't know how effective that will really be never really tried it its not a typical ADC item ill be sure to try this out next time but I also would like advice from people

thank you in advance :)

but what if my support its someone like {{champion:53}} or {{champion:89}} unless they are a god they cant really stop him from killing me (not trying to argue)

Actually with Blitz and Leona they can just stand on top of you, activate E(blitz) or Q(Leo) and use the attack-move command to circle you. As soon as rengar becomes visible they will cc him and you can then turn on him with their help. So long as you're not near any bushes the Rengar will have no further way to get to you (except flash) and you can kite him until hes dead.

but isnt his combo basically instant I feel by the time the blitz E goes through ill already be dead his Q does do like 1000 physical damage and if he gets{{item:3095}} his leap will do even more because of its passive

Not quite instant, attack move is faster than a Rengar player's ability to smash Q to auto-attack reset. He may get some of his damage off, but it won't all go off without a hitch.

Also those supports can build {{item:3109}} Knignt's Vow and {{item:3190}} Locket of the Iron Solari to help protect you from the initial burst damage.
If they're literal gods, they can hook/CC him while he's leaping.
Attack-move takes a lot of the difficulty out of it. As long as no other enemies are within range then they just have to stay close to you.

There are no counters to Rengar, outside of just banning him every single game.  His kit is the least-balanced in the game; not the least-balanceable mind you, I can think of several others that are worse.  However, being 1-shot, regardless of your item choices or champion pick (I've seen a 4-armor-item Malphite get 1-shot from 110% HP before,) just for leaving the home pad while there's a level 6+ Rengar in the game is one of the most anti-fun aspects of League.

My answer has been to ban him every single game, like I said above.  So far it's worked for me over these past multiple years. *shrug*

Adcs typically have the least amount of options when it comes to outplaying, as they're designed to be glass cannons with team comps built around them.

If you must play adc, I would suggest playing the more self-sufficient ones like Graves, Ezreal, and Vayne. It's still not easy, but they have it easier than most when it comes to dealing with assassins and divers.

Outside of adcs, other classes generally have tools for dealing with champs like Rengar.

> [{quoted}](name=ZackTheWaffleMan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zvmjrgR9,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-06-25T21:59:47.175+0000)
>
> Wait, is ADC Graves viable?

Graves can carry from the jungle. He tends to outscale most of the low-utility picks, and can outduel a fair amount of them after picking up his first damage item.
Also Kai'Sa once she gets her stealth can handle assassins like Rengar fairly well too.

Unfortunately for you, assassins are supposed to counter marksmen. If you want to counter them, you're going to have to stay near teammates who can peel for you and/or turn on that assassin when they try to dive onto you.

It's not the marksman's job to counter assassins, it's the support's job.

...Don't play typical ADC's that aren't meta :3

Rengar is a champion that lives on squishies. If you could counter him easily, he wouldn't be viable. I think getting around him depends mostly on the champion that you play, and above all else, make sure to GROUP UP. At least then he'll die, even if you do too.
